variables.name: client_name
variables.description: Name of the client company or organization
variables.style: Plain text, title case

variables.name: project_name
variables.description: Name or title of the automation project
variables.style: Plain text, title case

variables.name: project_summary
variables.description: Two to three sentence summary of the project and its objectives
variables.style: Concise paragraph format, 2-3 sentences. Emphasize key technologies, metrics, and important outcomes.

variables.name: date_created
variables.description: Date when the scope document was created
variables.style: Format: YYYY-MM-DD or Month DD, YYYY

variables.name: stakeholders
variables.description: List of client representatives and internal team leads involved in the project
variables.style: Each item: 'Name - Position' (e.g., 'John Smith - CEO', 'Sarah Johnson - Operations Manager')

variables.name: process_mapping_description
variables.description: Description of the current manual process or system being used
variables.style: Concise paragraph. Emphasize key steps, roles, tools, and time estimates. Avoid verbose explanations.

variables.name: time_effort_cost
variables.description: Time, effort, and cost currently involved in the manual process
variables.style: Concise description emphasizing specific numbers (hours, costs, FTEs). Focus on quantifiable metrics.

variables.name: pain_points
variables.description: Key inefficiencies, bottlenecks, or challenges identified in the current process
variables.style: Top 3–5 items only. Each item: brief, specific pain point (e.g., 'Manual data entry takes 10+ hours weekly'). Avoid redundancy.

variables.name: existing_tools_systems
variables.description: List of tools, software, or platforms currently used
variables.style: Each item: Tool/platform name with brief context (e.g., 'Salesforce CRM', 'Excel spreadsheets for tracking', 'Gmail for communication')

variables.name: automation_scope
variables.description: Processes or workflows targeted for automation
variables.style: Concise paragraph (NO numbered list). Emphasize specific features, systems, and key capabilities. Focus on what's being automated and why. Write as flowing prose without list formatting.

variables.name: high_level_workflow
variables.description: ASCII art diagram showing workflow with trigger, numbered steps, and substeps
variables.style:
Create a text art diagram with:
- Clear TRIGGER at the top
- Numbered HIGH-LEVEL STEPS (1., 2., 3., etc.)
- Indented substeps under each (a), b), c), etc.)
- Use arrows (→, ↓) and simple boxes/lines
- Keep it visual and easy to scan
- Be concise - use brief phrases, not full sentences
Example format:
┌─────────────────────────┐
│ TRIGGER: Event occurs   │
└───────────┬─────────────┘
            ↓
    1. First major step
       a) Substep detail
       b) Another substep
            ↓
    2. Second major step
       a) Substep here

variables.name: tech_stack
variables.description: Tools and platforms involved in the automation solution
variables.style: Each item: Tool/platform name - Brief purpose. Be concise. Format: 'Name - Purpose'

variables.name: data_sources
variables.description: All inputs for the automation
variables.style: Each item: Source name/type (e.g., 'Client CRM database', 'Web forms', 'Email attachments', 'API endpoints')

variables.name: automation_outputs
variables.description: What the automation delivers
variables.style: Each item: Output type/format (e.g., 'Automated email responses', 'Generated PDF reports', 'Dashboard updates', 'Slack notifications')

variables.name: integration_points
variables.description: List of systems that require integration with the automation
variables.style: Each item: System name with integration method (e.g., 'Salesforce via REST API', 'Google Sheets via OAuth', 'Slack via Webhooks')

variables.name: security_considerations
variables.description: Data protection and compliance requirements for the project
variables.style: 2–4 short lines. Concrete measures and standards only (e.g., GDPR, SOC 2). Avoid boilerplate and long lists.

variables.name: scalability
variables.description: Assessment of whether the automation can handle increased volumes or additional features
variables.style: 2–4 short lines. Include concrete limits/capacities or thresholds. Avoid vague generalities.

variables.name: risks
variables.description: Potential risks and challenges
variables.style: Top 3–5 items only. Generalize recurring themes into one bullet (e.g., 'API rate limits may affect throughput'); avoid provider-specific rate numbers.

variables.name: assumptions_requirements
variables.description: Key assumptions and requirements
variables.style: 3–6 concise bullets. Each item a single sentence requirement/assumption (e.g., 'Client provides API access within 1 week').

variables.name: timeline_milestones
variables.description: Phases with durations and key milestones
variables.style: One line per phase: 'Phase – short description: X weeks (Y hr)'. Include Y hr per phase. The sum of all Y across phases MUST equal total hours from dev_hours + training_hours + pm_hours. Keep it concise (3–6 lines), not a paragraph.

variables.name: deliverable_checkpoints
variables.description: Weekly deliverable checkpoints showing progress milestones
variables.style: Each item: 'Week X: Deliverable description' or 'Week X.X: Deliverable description' (e.g., 'Week 1: API integrations functional', 'Week 2.5: Basic scope generation working')

variables.name: approval_workflow
variables.description: Process for approving the scope document
variables.style: Single sentence or short paragraph (e.g., 'Written confirmation via email suffices for approval of this plan.')

variables.name: dev_hours
variables.description: Development hours total
variables.style: Format: 'X hours'. No parentheses or breakdown; include breakdown in Timeline & Milestones instead.

variables.name: training_hours
variables.description: User training/Communication hours total
variables.style: Format: 'X hours'. No parentheses or breakdown.

variables.name: pm_hours
variables.description: Project Management hours total
variables.style: Format: 'X hours'. No parentheses or breakdown.

variables.name: subscription_licensing_costs
variables.description: List of subscription and licensing costs for various tools/platforms
variables.style: Each item: 'Tool/Platform: Cost/period'. Use current product names only; avoid outdated model names (e.g., avoid 'gpt-4'). Prefer generic phrasing like 'AI API usage: ~$X/month (usage-dependent)'. No parentheses explanations.

variables.name: total_setup_cost
variables.description: Total one-time setup cost
variables.style: Format: '$X'. No parentheses or breakdown here.

variables.name: monthly_operating_cost
variables.description: Total monthly operating cost for subscriptions
variables.style: Format: '~$X/month'. No parentheses explanations.

variables.name: current_process_cost
variables.description: Breakdown of current process costs including time spent, hourly rates, error correction costs, and total annual cost
variables.style: Each item: Cost component with calculation (e.g., 'Employee time: 60 hours/month × 12 months × $50/hour = $36,000/year', 'Error correction: ~$6,000/year', 'Total annual cost: $42,000-$60,000')

variables.name: automation_benefits
variables.description: Breakdown of automation benefits including time savings, error reduction, response time improvements, and total annual savings
variables.style: Each item: Benefit with value (e.g., 'Time savings: $32,400-$48,600/year (90% reduction)', 'Error reduction: $5,400/year', 'Total annual savings: $42,800-$59,000')

variables.name: roi_summary
variables.description: Summary of ROI including percentage in first year and ongoing annual savings
variables.style: Format: 'X% ROI in first year with ongoing savings of $Y annually'. Be concise and impactful.

variables.name: appendices
variables.description: Any additional documentation or references
variables.style: One reference per line: 'Title – URL'. No run-on sentences. Keep it short.
